Goal 1. Eradicate extreme poverty and hunger
Target 1.B: Achieve full and productive employment and decent work for all_including women and young people
Employment to population ratio 15+ total

DataTables
Goal 1. Eradicate extreme poverty and hunger
Target 1.A: Halve - between 1990 and 2015 - the proportion of people whose income is less than one dollar a day
Poverty gap at $1.25 a day (PPP) (%)
Poverty gap at $2 a day (PPP) (%)
Poverty gap at national poverty line (%)
Poverty gap at rural poverty line (%)
Poverty gap at urban poverty line (%)
Poverty headcount ratio at $1.25 a day (PPP)
Poverty headcount ratio at $2 a day (PPP)
Poverty headcount ratio at national poverty line
Poverty headcount ratio at rural poverty line
Poverty headcount ratio at urban poverty line
Target 1.B: Achieve full and productive employment and decent work for all_including women and young people
Employment to population ratio 15+ total
Employment to population ratio 15+ male
Employment to population ratio 15+ female
Goal 2. Achieve universal primary education
Target 2.A: Ensure that by 2015 children everywhere_boys and girls alike_will be able to complete a full course of primary schooling
School enrollment, primary (% net)
Total enrollment primary (% net)
Primary completion rate, total (% of relevant age group)
Persistence to last grade of primary, female (% of cohort)
Persistence to last grade of primary, male (% of cohort)
Persistence to last grade of primary, total (% of cohort)
Literacy rate adult total (% of people ages 15 and above
Literacy rate youth female (% of females ages 15-24)
Literacy rate youth male (% of males ages 15-24)
Literacy rate youth total (% of people ages 15-24)
Goal 3. Promote gender equality and empower women
Target 3.A: Eliminate gender disparity in primary and secondary education_preferably by 2005_and in all levels of education no later than 2015
Proportion of seats held by women in national parliaments (%)
Ratio of female to male secondary enrollment (%)
Ratio of female to male tertiary enrollment (%)
Ratio of girls to boys in primary and secondary education (%)
Ratio of female to male primary enrollment (%)
Share of women employed in the nonagricultural sector
Goal 4. Reduce child mortality
Target 4.A: Reduce by two-thirds_between 1990 and 2015_the under-five mortality rate
Mortality rate under-5 (per 1,000)
Mortality rate infant (per 1000 live births)
Immunization measles (% of children ages 12-23 months)
Goal 5. Improve maternal health
Target 5.A: Reduce by three quarters_between 1990 and 2015_the maternal mortality ratio
Maternal mortality ratio
Births attended by skilled health staff (% of total)
Target 5.B: Achieve_by 2015_universal access to reproductive health
Unmet need for contraception (% of married women ages 15-49)
Adolescent fertility rate (births per 1,000 women ages 15-19)
Goal 6. Combat HIV-AIDS_malaria and other diseases
Target 6.A: Have halted by 2015 and begun to reverse the spread of HIV-AIDS
Prevalence of HIV female (% ages 15-24)
Prevalence of HIV male (% ages 15-24)
Prevalence of HIV total % of population ages 15-49
Comprehensive correct knowledge of HIV-AIDS ages 15-24 female
Comprehensive correct knowledge of HIV-AIDS ages 15-24 male
Condom use with non regular partner % adults(15-49) female
Condom use with non regular partner % adults(15-49) male
Condom use population ages 15-24 female
Condom use population ages 15-24 male
pct females_15-49_ having comprehensive knowledge about HIV
pct males_15-49_ having comprehensive knowledge about HIV
Ratio of school attendance of orphans to non-orphans ages 10-14
Target 6.B: Achieve_by 2010_universal access to treatment for HIV/AIDS for all those who need it
Antiretroviral therapy
Target 6.C: Have halted by 2015 and begun to reverse the incidence of malaria and other major diseases
Malaria cases reported
Children with fever receiving antimalarial drugs
Use of insecticide-treated bed nets (% of under-5 population)
Tuberculosis case detection rate (all forms)
Tuberculosis death rate (per 100,000 people)
Tuberculosis treatment success rate (% of registered cases)
Incidence of tuberculosis (per 100,000 people)
Goal 7. Ensure environmental sustainability
Target 7.A: Integrate the principles of sustainable development into country policies and programmes and reverse the loss of environmental resources
forest area (% of land area)
CO2 emissions (kg per PPP $ of GDP)
CO2 emissions (kt)
CO2 emissions (metric tons per capita)
Energy use-kg of oil equi.- per $1000 GDP
Annual freshwater withdrawals, total (% of internal resources)
Renewable internal freshwater resources per capita-cubic meters
Target 7.B: Reduce biodiversity loss_achieving_by 2010_a significant reduction in the rate of loss
Terrestrial protected areas (% of total surface area)
Marine protected areas
Target 7.C: Halve_by 2015_the proportion of people without sustainable access to safe drinking water and basic sanitation
Improved water source % of population with access
Annual freshwater withdrawals, total (% of internal resources)
Renewable internal freshwater resources per capita-cubic meters
Target 7.D: By 2020_to have achieved a significant improvement in the lives of at least 100 million slum dwellers
Population living in slums (% of urban population)
Goal 8. Develop a global partnership for development
Target 8.A: Develop further an open_rule-based_predictable_non-discriminatory trading and financial system
tariffs imposed by developed countries on agricultural products
tariffs imposed by developed countries on agri. products-LDCs
tariffs imposed by developed countries on clothingproducts
tariffs imposed by developed countries on textilel products
tariffs imposed by developed countries on textilel products LDCs
Agricultural support estimate (% of GDP)
Target 8.B: Address the special needs of the least developed countries
Net ODA provided to the least developed countries (current US$)
Net ODA provided to the least developed countries (pct. of GNI)
Net ODA provided total (% of GNI
Net ODA provided total (constant 2008 US$)
Net ODA provided total (current US$)
Net ODA received (% of GNI)
Net ODA received per capita (current US$)
Net ODA received (current US$)
Net ODA and official aid received (current US$)
Bilateral ODA commitments that is untied
Bilateral, sector-allocable ODA to basic social services
Target 8.C: Address the special needs of landlocked countries and small island developing States
Target 8.D: Deal comprehensively with the debt problems of developing countries through national and international measures in order to make debt sustainable in the long term
